definition: to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: He might also want to avoid exhaustion.
sentences.chinese: 他可能想躲避烦劳的工作。

sentences.english: What problem you will always meet or let you feel boring.
sentences.chinese: 你最常遇到，最令你烦劳的问题是什么？

sentences.english: Dr Livesey take the north side, if you please;
sentences.chinese: 利弗西医生，烦劳你守住北面。

sentences.english: The doctor said anxiety, and stress may lead to compromised health.
sentences.chinese: 医生说，思虑和烦劳过度会导致心血暗耗。

sentences.english: Would you mind taking a few books to him?
sentences.chinese: 这样将可以使我省掉一些烦劳。

sentences.english: What problem you suffer the most trouble?
sentences.chinese: 你最常遇到，最令你烦劳的问题是什么？

definition: to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
undue trouble/Thank you for having gone out of your way to help me.
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to come with a specific purpose in mind
I beg to disturb you/I trespass on your hospitality/Thank you for your hospitality!
